choices.D: Both interfaces must be in different VDOMs.
choices.B: Both interfaces must have the same VLAN ID.
choices.A: Both interfaces must belong to the same forward domain.
choices.C: The role of the VLAN10 interface must be set to server.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibit shows the two VLAN interfaces configuration.
A DHCP server is connected to the VLAN10 interface. A DHCP client is connected to the VLAN5 interface. However, the DHCP client cannot get a dynamic IP address from the DHCP server.
What condition must exist in order for the DHCP client to successfully get the dynamic IP address?

discussion.content:
Hi polly,
i think could it might help FGT_Infrastructure-6.2, p.355

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibit contains a proxy address that an administrator created to block HTTP uploads.
Where must the proxy address be used?

choices.B: As the destination in a firewall policy
choices.A: As the source in a firewall policy
choices.D: As the source in a proxy policy
choices.C: As the destination in a proxy policy

discussion.content: A is Correct. FortiGate Security 6.2 page 165

C is correct.
see example at: https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.2.0/cookbook/510402/static-virtual-ips

questions.question_text:
An administrator has configured central DNAT and virtual IPs.
Which object can be selected in the firewall policy Destination field?

choices.A: The mapped IP address object of the VIP object
The web site www.bing.com is categorized by FortiGuard as Malicious Websites.
choices.D: The rating for the web site www.bing.com has been locally overridden to a category that is being blocked.
choices.B: The user has not authenticated with the FortiGate yet.
choices.C: The web server IP address 204.79.197.200 is categorized by FortiGuard as Malicious Websites.

discussion.content: It seems that D is correct based on debug "URL matches a local rating" and https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.2.0/cookbook/122974/web-rating-override

questions.question_text: By default, when logging to disk, when does FortiGate delete logs?
